when i came back, both my friends completed the coop history with each other
they are no longer my friends

the single-player campaign is good tho
good game

Эта игра самая замечательная головоломка в моей жизни. Головоломки очень интересные, ты погружаешься в их решение с головой. Сюжет тоже сделан на славу, следить за происходящем в этой игре интересно и увлекательно. Когда я всё же прошёл игру то меня просто переполняли эмоции от великолепной концовки. Portal 2 это игра которая стоит вашего внимания и даже внимания тех людей которые не любят головоломки.

If someone told me that I would fall in love with a game in which [spoiler] I get called fat and stupid by an AI potato whilst simultaneously having to solve puzzles in order to escape my death, [/spoiler] I'd  probably have thought they were more than a little bit deranged. 

However, the Portal series is exactly that; two fantastic games that got me hooked pretty quickly. I put off playing them for a while and I wish I had gotten to them sooner as they really are games that I think anyone will enjoy. 

With villains you can't really ever hate, GlaDOS' fantastic running commentary, suprisingly addictive puzzles, a pretty good sountrack [strike] and cake[/strike], I honestly see why Portal has such a big fanbase and I recommend this game to anyone and everyone who hasn't already played it.

Infinity IQ

Much to love about this game. The solo campaign builds up from the first Portal game, adding much gameplay, new mechanics, new characters and a lot of background story. This time, it is all about how Aperture Science came to be. It leaves out just enough details to keep you thinking. I was completely immersed from the beginning to the end.

Coop mode is also excellent! Easily one of the best coop games. The only downside is that you will get through the coop campaign too quickly for your liking. However, there is always the option to download user-made content and there sure is no shortage of maps to try!

Definitely one of my all-time favourite games!

Esse realmente é um jogo incrivel, ele é a continuação de Portal, joguei os dois e percebi que seu gameplay é realmente fora do normal além de ser rico em história, o jogo já começa em ação, você já pode controlar o personagem e muitas coisas acontecem e começa a se ligar com o primeiro jogo, ai que começa a pressão até que acontece algo inesperado que infelizmente você tem que fazer uma certa atitude para acabar o jogo. Valve caprichou muito nesse jogo pena que ela só sabe contar até 2 ^-^.
Had a great time playing this with a friend. There's no more support on the game, but its worth buying if you enjoy puzzles.

Portal 2 does everything right for a puzzle game. Great puzzles, terrific dialog, lengthy campaign, fun co-op, a level editor, mod support... what more could you ask for? The gameplay is very unique, the portals especially lead to satisfying levels and very interesting interactions with the other game mechanics. The 'test chamber' premise works extremely well to make self contained levels that make sense with the story, but at times you also get the feeling of blazing your own trial even within the contained environments. The characters and quips are hilarious and memorable, and even people who haven't played the game have probably heard retellings of some of the jokes. The co-op campaign makes sure to force you to work together at times while also providing ample opportunities to mess with your partner. Even once you've played through the campaign twice and beaten the co-op with everyone on your friends list, you can still go back and expierience it all again through community made levels and mods (Thinking with Time Machine and Aperature Tag are ones I've played and really enjoyed). If you haven't played it yet, do yourself a favor and pick it up (or wait for the periodic sales), it's well worth it.

[quote]For more puzzle game and platformer recommendations,  check out [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/29932239/]my Curator page[/url][/quote]

Definitely, definitely get this game. You dont have to have played the first game to play this one, cause you learn everything again, but it would explain some of the characters and storyline.

Normally i get bored of games very quickly. This one, however... It took me about 10 hours to play all the way through, in a couple of days. Never once got bored. If it had been a game with no storyline and endless test chambers, i would have been done with it in 3 hours. But this storyline is very engaging, with twists and turns and engaging puzzles and characters. You are the only human you ever see, and youre mute so its just two AI insulting you.

So yes, definitely get this game. Humorous, engaging, a litte creepy when its further along but nothing ever properly scares you.

结局把我暖哭了，我永远是GLaDOS的粉丝

As i said in my Portal review, the game was really amazing!

The atmosphere has improved dramatically, the puzzles have gotten harder, there are new mechanics, and there are more characters to interact with. You still have the ability to use portals to solve tests chambers and other are-oh wait! Did I forget to mention that you can go to different areas instead of just only just test chambers? So, according to all this information, I really recommend this game for people who liked the original Portal.

:)
